isis.stitle: CAB: 7000 AND 8000 SERIES MODELS - REMOVAL AND INSTALLATION - Ignition Switch And Ignition Switch Cylinder

svcproc.title: Ignition Switch And Ignition Switch Cylinder

svcprocinfo.para: The ignition switch and door locks are coded the same; one key operates both the ignition switch and the door locks. A plastic bag (kept with the vehicle) is stamped and bar-coded with the ignition switch and door lock cylinder code numbers. This plastic bag is to remain with the vehicle when it is delivered to the customer. It is very important that this plastic bag (with the code numbers) be kept by the customer in a safe, secure place for key replacement.

note.para: The code numbers do not appear on the ignition switch body or the door lock assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 108. Ignition Switch Trim and Nut

step1.para: Remove rubber trim from ignition switch.
Remove nut with a 1-1/8 inch thin wall socket.

figure.caption: Figure 109. Ignition Switch and Electrical Connector

step1.para: Push ignition switch through dash panel and disconnect electrical connector.
Connect ignition switch electrical connector to ignition switch ( Figure 109).
Insert ignition switch through dash panel ( Figure 108, Items 1 and 2).
Install nut and tighten with a 1-1/8 inch thin wall socket ( Figure 108, Item 4).
Insert ignition key into ignition switch and rotate key counterclockwise to the ACCESSORY position. This aligns the key with the release hole.

figure.caption: Figure 111. Ignition Switch Cylinder and Body

step1.para: Support ignition switch assembly in a vise with soft jaws.
Insert a 1/16- inch (2- mm) - diameter rod (paper clip will work) into release hole and depress.
Remove ignition switch cylinder from ignition switch body using ignition key and pulling straight out.

note.para: If vehicle keys are lost, drill out the ignition switch cylinder by using a 5/16- inch (8 mm-) drill bit and drill 1/2 to 3/4 inch (13 to 19 mm) deep. This will permit the tumblers to drop out and allow switch ignition cylinder removal.
If the original key is desired when replacing the ignition switch cylinder, code the new ignition switch using the following steps.

step1.para: Insert the original ignition key in the new ignition switch cylinder ( Figure 111 Items 1 and 2).
File off any tumblers that protrude from the ignition switch cylinder. Ensure no burrs are left on the tumblers. Remove the ignition key and blow all filings out with compressed air.
Apply a small quantity of powdered graphite to the tumblers and reinsert ignition key into the new ignition switch cylinder.
Rotate ignition key and ignition switch cylinder counterclockwise to the ACCESSORY position.
Insert ignition switch cylinder back into ignition switch body, turn key to OFF position and remove key ( Figure 110).
